seg.output: May grace and peace from God be upon us at all times.In particular, faithful herr and friend, I shall write to you from Berchtold concerning the news that our lords of Bern had understood in the assembly that we are forced to make submissive agreements and consent, however much it may be against our will that we and no one else will do otherwise.Therefore our lords, council and citizens of Bern have recognized on the 9th day of March and have sent the messengers on that day to Baden with the command to request that they appoint three messengers to us, one from Zurich or Bern, another from the other lesser lords, and the third from the vassals, and to find out how things stand with us and perhaps also to give us more help, so that we may be helped according to all necessity and honor of God.Having thus heard this report, whether it would have been better for us to have gone in person, that we should not be attacked on account of this business and that we may hold and counsel together all the sooner, our lords' messengers were sent with instructions to refuse [the offer] in the proper manner.Having written this, I shall send to you these messengers with a copy, if it seemed to you also to be a good idea to deal further in these matters, for you know well that we are doing good and lasting work in these things.

seg.output: Dear true lord and friend, I will write to you from Berchtold's report: then my lords of Bern understood at the meeting that we were forced to accept shameful terms and agree, be it known to us that no one else wanted it. Therefore, our lords council and citizens of Bern recognized on the ninth day of Brachmonet and sent the messengers to Baden with orders to request that three messengers be sent to us, one from Zurich or Bern, the other from other lesser lords, and the third from the nobles, to find out how things are with us and perhaps to do more for us, and thus, with all our need and honor of God, help can be given. Therefore we have this report, in case such a thing ever happened, that we would not be attacked in this matter, and that we may come together and consult. Then, although my lords from other places do not want to agree and allow more to happen and to further their plan, the messengers of my lords have been ordered, and rightly refused. Therefore, having thus written, they have sent these messengers to you with a copy, in case you find it good to further deal in these matters; for you know that we are useful and diligent in these things. And we are always true guards, as we trust you. Therefore, may God be served. We also hear how our lords from other places have come to the lords of Zurich with much clamor and have requested many good things.

Datum uff zinstag nach Sant Medardus tag im 32 jar.
Hanß Mutschly, ü[wer] alzit willig[er] d[iener] und frund.
Dem wollgelertten Meister Henrich Bullinger, minem lieben heren und fründ.
seg.output:
Beloved and faithful servant and friend, I write to you this report: My lords from Bern have understood that we are forced to accept their decrees and surrender, although it be against our will and that of no one else. Therefore, our lords and citizens of Bern have recognized this on the 9th day of break month and have given orders to send their envoys to Baden on the day, to ask that three envoys be sent to us, one from Zurich or Bern, another from other lesser lords, and the third from the common people, to learn of our situation and perhaps even to further our cause. This is the report, which, if followed, will ensure that we are not attacked in this matter and that we may gather and discuss together. Although the lesser lords may not wish to send and further their cause, our envoys have commanded them rightly. Therefore, I have decided to send you this letter along with a copy, in case you may also find it beneficial to deal in these matters, since you know that it would be beneficial to us and that we must act swiftly in these matters. We are always faithful servants, and we trust you completely. May God bless you. We have also heard that our lesser lords have gone before the lords of Zurich with great talk and have obtained much good. May it be so or not, may God unite heart and mouth.
Given on Tuesday after the feast of Saint Medardus in the 32nd year.
Hans Mutschly, ever willing servant and friend.
To the well-learned Master Henrich Bullinger, my dear lord and friend.

seg.output: May God's grace and peace be with us all at all times. In particular, my true lord and friend, I write this report from Berchtold: my lords of Bern have understood that we are compelled to accept certain conditions and concede, although it be repugnant to us, that we and no one else has any different opinion. Therefore, our lords and citizens of Bern have decided on the ninth day of the month of Brachmonat to send messengers to Baden with orders to request that three messengers be sent to us, one from Zurich or Bern, the other from other lesser lords, and the third from the Schidlütte, and to learn how things stand with us, and perhaps to do something for our benefit, so that, with God's help, we may be delivered from all our needs and troubles. In this regard, if this should come to pass, then we shall not be attacked on some pretext, so that we may hold and consult together more securely. But if the other lords were to refuse to agree and to go ahead with their plan, then my lords' messengers shall be instructed accordingly. Therefore, I have written this letter, and I send you the copy thereof, so that you might also consider whether it be well to act in this matter; for you know that it would be to our advantage and benefit to do so.

seg.output: Dear trusted friend and ally, I shall write to you from Berchtold concerning news: my lords of Bern have understood that we are forced to submit to oppressive statutes and agree that it is far better for us that we all agree to the same thing and nobody else wants anything else. Therefore, our lords and citizens of Bern have decided on the 9th day of Brachmonat to send a messenger to Baden to request that three messengers be sent to us, one from Zurich or Bern, another from the other lesser lords, and the third from Schidluten, and there to find out how things stand with us, and perhaps do something else for us, and thus by the grace of God help us in all our necessities. Thus, with this news, if it should be that some kind of good result should come of it, that we should not be attacked in this matter, and that we can hold together and consult with each other. But if the lords of the other side think to not accept it and let further things happen and proceed with their intent, our lords' messengers in command have justly refused them. Thus, in this writing, I have thought to send these messengers to you with a copy, if you think it good to also handle these matters; for you know that it is of use to us and that we must act swiftly in these things. We are ever your faithful guardians, as we trust you fully. Thus, may God be served. We also hear how our lords of the other side have come with much loud talking to the lords of Zurich and have asked for many favors.

Insunders getrüwer her und fründ, ich wird uß her Berchtold schryben bericht: alsdan min heren von Bern verstanden hand zuͤ tagen , daß wir gezwungen werden zun bebschlichen satzuͤngen und fürgewent , es sig bin unß wit daß mer und niemand, der anders welle . Uff daß habent unser heren rett und burger zuͤ Bern erkennt uff dem 9. tag brachmonet und den botten uff den tag gen Baden in befelchs geben , ze begeren, daß man drig botten zuͤ uns verordne, einen von Zürich oder Bern , den anderen von lenderen minner heren, den dritten von schidlüten , und da ze erfaren, wies umm unß stande, und vilicht noch einist bin unß ze meren , und darmit üch nach aller noturfft und eren gotz mocht gehollffen werden. Hatt allso unß deß bericht, obs solcher ir menig ein fürgang wurd han , daß wir des handells halb nit uberfallen wuͤrdent und wir unß dester fuͤrer zesamen halten und beratten mogen. Dan ob glich min heren von lenderen vermeinent, nit ze statten und witter meren lassen und mit irem fürnemen fürfaren, habent miner heren botten in empfelch , innen recht fürzeschlachen . Hatt also in sim schryben vermeitt, disen botten zü üch mit der abschrifft ze schicken, ob üch vilicht ouch gut beduchti , witter in denen sachen ze handlen; dan ir woll wussent, das wir nützit zuͤ und in dissen dingen dorent thun. Und sind alwegen unser trüwer wechter, als dan wir üch getzlich [!] vertruwen. Darmit sind got befolchen. Wir vernend ouch, wie dan unser heren von lenderen mit vill geluttem geschwetz vor minen heren von Zürich gesin sind und vil guts sich erbotten hand. Mag sin oder nit, well gott, daß mund und hertz bin einandern sig.
Datum uff zinstag nach Sant Medardus tag im 32 jar.
Hanß Mutschly , ü[wer] alzit willig[er] d[iener] und frund.
Dem wollgelertten Meister Henrich Bullinger, minem lieben heren und fründ.
seg.output:
Dear true friend and master, I will write to you about Berchtold: my lords of Bern understood that we must submit to certain conditions and agree, whether it be to us or no-one else who wants things to be different. Therefore, our lords and citizens of Bern declared on the 9th day of July and sent messengers to Baden to request that three messengers be sent to us, one from Zurich or Bern, another from the other lords, and a third from the Schidlüten, to find out how things stand with us and perhaps to find a solution to our problems so that God might help us in our need. Therefore, I have reported this to you, so that we may not be attacked because of this and that we may consult and advise each other. Although the other lords did not want to come to any agreement and followed their own ideas, my lords' messengers were able to convince them otherwise. Therefore, I ask you to send these messengers with a copy of this letter, in case you find it useful to act further in this matter, for you know that it is beneficial to us and that we must do our best in this matter. We are always your true guardians, and we trust you completely. God be with you. We also hear that our lords from the other side have gone to Zurich with much talk and have requested many things of them. May it be or not, God knows, that the minds and hearts of all be in agreement.
Dated Tuesday after the feast of Saint Medardus, in the 32nd year.
Hanß Mutschly, your always willing servant and friend.
To the well-learned Master Henrich Bullinger, my dear lord and friend.
